boat.name: Wind Song
boat.full_description:
'Wind Song' is the first Maurice Griffiths boat, built in 1928/9 by  G. Feltham of Portsmouth for Henry Tompson who had seen the design for a Shallow Draught Wildfowling Yacht in Yachting Monthly and who wanted a boat for winter sport in Chichester Harbour. She is teak on elm with very flat bilge and an unusual but strong centreboard which operates by tackle through a slot in the foredeck. With the plate up she draws only 2' 6", ideal for creek crawling.

Maurice Griffiths owned the boat for a few years from 1949 by which time she had a tall Bermudian rig, no bowsprit and apparently rather questionable handling. She features on the cover of his book Sixty Years a Yacht Designer. 

She survived a fire in the early 1970s and was later owned by Dr Rhyss Jones whose son, Griff comments rather unfavourably on her in his autobiography!

An excellent restoration in the 1990s included the return of the gaff rig, the laid deck being replaced by epoxy covered plywood and the fitting of a number of floors which evidently had been omited from the original construction, thus eliminating a number of leaks which had plagued the boat for some years.

After many years on the East Coast she returned to Chichester Harbour and continues to give much pleasure pottering about the Solent.

In 2014 the old faithful Volvo diesel was replaced by a modern Beta 25 HP.
boat.construction_details: Carvel teak on Canadian rock elm
boat.short_description: Wind Song is the first boat built to a Maurice Griffith design.
